exposition.irish: Seas Scáthach ar chnoic fhraoigh Sgitheanach.
exposition.english: The Shadowed one stood upon the heathered hills of Skye.

exposition.irish: Éist liom, laoch dána, agus tuigfaid tu an bogha
exposition.english: Hark to me, bold hero, and you will understand the bow

exposition.irish: Tarraing síar agus scaoil gan fearg, gan fonn, gan faitíos
exposition.english: 'Draw and release without anger, without desire, without fear'

onHit.irish: Maith. Ach ní hé an sprioc an bua.
onHit.english: Good. But the target is not the victory.

onHit.irish: S'ea. Nochtan an saighead an chroí.
onHit.english: It is so. The arrow reveals the heart.

onHit.irish: Sin é. Scaoiltear an saighead ón intinn, ar dtus.
onHit.english: That's it. First the arrow is released from the mind.

onMiss.irish: Haw! Chaitheann do saighead a neart go fánach ar an talamh fliuch
onMiss.english: Ha! Thine arrow squanders it's might upon the sodden earth
Look ye now, O archer of frail intent!

onMiss.irish: Seo! Scaipann tú sháigheada chun na muc fiáine a chur ag gáire!
onMiss.english: Lo! Thou scatter the arrows to the glee of forest pigs!
Thy shafts, o unsteady hand, make their bed in the ground.
onMiss.irish: Tá do sháigheada, a lámh guagach, ag luí ar an talamh.

farewell.irish: Mar sin a chaith Scáthach breithiúnas ar foghlaim; le teanga géar agus súile gealán
farewell.english: Thus did Scáthach cast her judgment upon learning;  with sharp tongue and eyes ablaze

farewell.irish: Seachas slán, leabhair sí le cinnteacht tairngire:
farewell.english: Instead of farewell, she spoke with the certainty of prophecy:

farewell.irish: 'Choinóigh tú saigheada ullamh, agus cothrom na Féinne i do chroí.'
farewell.english: 'You shall keep arrows ready, and justice in your heart.'
